attributes.action: Create a national safeguarding database.
attributes.background: Too many safeguarding cases go under the radar and have unknown outcomes.  As the way things stand now; disclosures are made and followed up. If the parents are ‘caught’ they sometimes leave the setting/more to a new one or if more serious issue/move out of the area or can be lying and deceptive.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent this from happening there would be a national safeguarding and child protection database. This would have any safeguarding, child protection cases uploaded so that every local authority and council could see the case files and would be flagged up as soon as the family move in to the area. All professionals involved in the case would have access to the database to upload their case notes.

attributes.action: Reform use of non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) in employment
attributes.background: Settlements that include NDAs remain secret. This can perpetuate a culture of bullying and victimisation and allow abuse to remain unchallenged. All NDAs should explicitly say that employees or ex-employees are allowed to talk about any bullying and harassment they might have seen or experienced.
attributes.additional_details: The opposite view, that payments routinely reward false allegations, also leads to the same conclusion. These NDAs are inappropriate.

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Increase the standard fine and points for driving in closed motorway lanes.
attributes.background: Despite radio ads, we still often see drivers waiting til the very last second to move out of closed lanes with a red X, often passing through a mile or so of warnings. Those caught in the accident and the police/ambulance service are put at risk by the idiocy of people in a hurry.
attributes.additional_details:
The current fines are either not charged, or aren't an adequate deterrent for vehicle users to not use them. Suggested alternatives - as the Highways Authority are informed of where an accident may be and which lanes to close, suggest turning on any cameras available to catch people. The cameras only need be turned on when the lane is closed.

If caught, increase the fine to £150 and 6 penalty points. Alternatively, for each gantry driven through with a red X give them the standard fine.

attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Make using red flashing lights on recovery trucks mandatory.
attributes.background: In 2018 alone we have had some very tragic incidents on the roads that could of been prevented. A lack of concentration whilst driving at speed is killing innocent workers. More needs to be done to protect workers roadside. Hitting a stationary vehicle on the hard shoulder shouldn't happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike blue flashing lights, amber lights grant no priority in traffic and are used to solely to emphasize a vehicle, often due to being a hazard. AKA non important
.Vehicles that use amber flashing lights include:

Road / highway maintenance vehicle 
Refuse collection vehicle
Breakdown recovery vehicle
the list goes on.

Most vehicles that do any kind of civil work have amber flashing lights, they are abused and misused, giving drivers the indication they are not important. This needs to change. All recovery trucks to have flashing reds fitted so motorist understand drivers need the room to operate. Workers to return home safe, not in a coffin.

attributes.action: UK Government should work with Dumfries and Galloway Council to house refugees
attributes.background: Many refugees live in awful horrible conditions and we do not. There is so much space here in Dumfries and Galloway and I want the refugees to have the same opportunities that we have.
attributes.additional_details: Countries close to war torn countries have begun to refuse letting in refugees. It is a selfish act to deprive others of the things we take for granted every day. Let refugees come here.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum rate of tax on tax avoidance schemes to help fund the NHS
attributes.background: The introduction of a minimum income/corporate tax rate for individuals/companies would immediately raise tens of billions in additional tax receipts each year to help fund the NHS without the need to raise existing tax rates for the middle-classes, cut funding for benefits or borrow more money.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently, tax avoiders can legally reduce the tax liability on their income to next to nothing without any restriction or recourse!

Any individual/company based in the UK that uses a known avoidance scheme or has connected parties/subsidiaries whose effective tax rate is less than 15% should pay the new minimum tax rate. 
The New 15% Minimum Tax Rate will apply to UK income and to all income recorded in low tax jurisdictions whether or not it is remitted back to UK.

attributes.action: Ban outdoors barbecuing of meat & fish.
attributes.background: Just as the weather has warmed up so has the preponderance for barbecuing outdoors. Being able to enjoy time in the garden is spoiled by the disgusting smell of burning flesh and barbecue smoke.
attributes.additional_details: The char is laden with cancer-causing compounds called heterocyclic amines that form when meat and high heat are combined to create a blackened crust. Barbecue smoke contains polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons toxic chemicals that can damage your lungs.

attributes.action: Compulsory training for food establishments with an FSA score of less than 3
attributes.background: We want the law changed in that all food establishments who score below a 3 on a hygiene inspection by the FSA, are required to take on an outside agency to retrain staff and owners. Should their scores not improve following training, then they should be closed down.
attributes.additional_details:
Having become aware of establishments that are allowed to stay open despite having a low FSA score and potentially putting the general public at risk due to their lack of management skills, hygiene & food safety, there now is a serious need for the system to be looked at.
At present anyone can open a food outlet, whether it be a restaurant, cafe, takeaway, outside catering or a bakery, with only the requirement of a certificate; which can easily be obtained online. Whilst this promotes & aids businesses, it also opens the floodgates to public safety. The training would be at the cost of the business. It would create jobs as well as assisting the businesses in gaining the scores that they should have & maintain high standards in the food industry & public safety.
